intro: Dorstenia nervosa f. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved woolly vine, is a unique plant characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to Central and South America. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. The f. latifolia form is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to the typical variety.
